test-case.name: ApplyingADiscountCode
test-case.output: -> Unknown browser - starting chrome Given I have added an item to the cart -> On shop page. -> Item is Polo -> On cart page. -> done: CheckCouponSteps.GivenIHaveAddedAnItemToTheCart() (2.4s) When I apply the coupon 'edgewords' on the cart page -> done: CheckCouponSteps.WhenIApplyTheDiscountOnTheCartPage("edgewords") (0.3s) Then the total cost reflects the discount of 15% -> The Expected discount is: 3.0000, the actual discount found was 3.00 -> The expected total is 20.9500, the actual total found was 20.95 -> Test finished. -> done: CheckCouponSteps.ThenTheTotalCostReflectsTheDiscountOf(15) (1.3s) -> Item removed from cart. -> Cart is already empty. -> Cart is already empty.

test-case.name: OrderNumberShowsInOrderHistory
test-case.output: -> Unknown browser - starting chrome Given I have added an item to the cart -> On shop page. -> Item is Hoodie with Pocket -> On cart page. -> done: CheckCouponSteps.GivenIHaveAddedAnItemToTheCart() (2.4s) When I go through the checkout process with these credentials --- table step argument --- | userFName | userLName | userCountry | userStreet | userCity | userPostcode | userPhoneNo | | first | last | United Kingdom | 30 test road | test city | YO10 4DP | 07777 777777 | On Checkout page. -> done: OrderNumberSteps.WhenIGoThroughTheCheckoutProcessWithTheseCredentials(<table>) (3.2s) Then my order will appear in my order history -> Order number is 6644 -> On My account => orders page. -> Order number 2 is: 6644 -> Test finished. -> done: OrderNumberSteps.ThenMyOrderWillAppearInMyOrderHistory() (3.0s) -> Cart is already empty.
